title: Cravat End, mid-18th century
medium:
Medium: linen
Technique: bobbin lace, Brussels style
creditline: Bequest of Richard Cranch Greenleaf in memory of his mother, Adeline Emma Greenleaf
description: In the center of the cravat end is a figure of Minerva below a canopy within symmetric tulip garden setting of balustrades, finials entwined by floral garlands and standing on arched trelliswork bases. Potted orange trees on bases are balanced by two long-tailed birds perching on either side of the lower balustrade. Floral sprays create allover pattern in remaining areas.

exhibitions.title: The Cooper-Hewitt Collections: A Design Resource

tombstone.epitaph:
Cravat End, mid-18th century.
mid-18th century. Medium: linen
